entry.et: Middle English beten, from Old English bēatan; akin to Old High German bōzan to beat

def.dt: :to strike repeatedly:
:to hit repeatedly so as to inflict pain often used with up
:to walk on :tread beat the pavement looking for work
:to strike directly against forcefully and repeatedly :dash against
:to flap or thrash at vigorously
:to strike at in order to rouse game
:to range over in or as if in quest of game
:to mix by stirring :whip often used with up
:to strike repeatedly in order to produce music or a signal beat a drum
:to drive or force by blows beat back his attackers
:to pound into a powder, paste, or pulp
:to make by repeated treading or driving over beat a path
:to dislodge by repeated hitting beat dust from the carpet
:to lodge securely by repeated striking beat a stake into the ground
:to shape by beating beat swords into plowshares
:to flatten thin by blows
:to sound or express especially by drumbeat
:to cause to strike or flap repeatedly a bird beating its wings
:overcome defeat
:surpass often used with out
:to prevail despite beat the odds
:bewilder baffle it beats me how she does it
:fatigue exhaust
:to leave dispirited, irresolute, or hopeless
:cheat swindle
:to act ahead of usually so as to forestall
:to report a news item in advance of
:to come or arrive before
:circumvent beat the system
:to outmaneuver (a defender) and get free
:to score against (a goalkeeper)
:to indicate by beating beat the tempo
:to become forcefully impelled :dash
:to glare or strike with oppressive intensity
:to sustain distracting activity
:to beat a drum
:pulsate throb
:tick
:to sound upon being struck
:to strike repeated blows beating on the door
:to strike the air :flap
:to strike cover in order to rouse game
:to range or scour for or as if for game
:to progress with much difficulty
:to sail to windward by a series of tacks
:to fail or refuse to come to the point in discourse
:to leave in haste
:to hurry away :scram
:hurry rush
:to try intently to resolve something difficult by thinking
:to search thoroughly through all possible areas
:to proclaim as meritorious or significant :publicize vigorously
:to defeat or surpass overwhelmingly
:to escape or evade the penalties connected with an accusation or charge
:to attack physically or verbally
:in a very energetic or forceful manner talking away to beat the band
:a single stroke or blow especially in a series
:pulsation tick
:a sound produced by or as if by beating
:a driving impact or force
:one swing of the pendulum or balance of a timepiece
:a regularly traversed round the cop on the beat
:a group of news sources that a reporter covers regularly
:a metrical or rhythmic stress in poetry or music or the rhythmic effect of these stresses
:the tempo indicated (as by a conductor) to a musical performer
:the pronounced rhythm that is the characteristic driving force in some types of music (as jazz or rock)
:rock 2
:one that excels I've never seen the beat of it
:the reporting of a news story ahead of competitors
:deadbeat
:an act of beating to windward
:one of the reaches so traversed :tack
:each of the pulsations of amplitude produced by the union of sound or radio waves or electric currents having different frequencies
:an accented stroke (as of one leg or foot against the other) in dancing
:moment waited a beat before responding

entry.et: Middle English beten, bete, from past participle of beten

def.dt: :being in a state of exhaustion :exhausted
:sapped of resolution or morale
:of, relating to, or being beatniks beat poets
:beatnik
:repel
:masturbate used of a male
:to make or perform by or as if by beating
:to mark or accompany by beating
:to turn (a routine ground ball or a bunt) into a hit in baseball by fast running to first base
:dilapidated shabby
:music (as rock) characterized by a heavy persistent beat
:a repetitive drum pattern in hip-hop and dance music
:music based on break beats
:world music usually hyphenated when used attributively
